caption:
The photograph features a roughly circular, hand-painted wooden sign mounted on a vertical black post. The sign, looking weather-worn with jagged, uneven edges and chipped paint, displays a warning message in hand-written, black capital letters. The message contains several misspellings or abbreviations and reads, "NO TRESPES, PRIVET PROPERTY, NO FISHING ALLOW, KEEP OUT."

Attached to the post is a strand of barbed wire that appears to extend off the frame, implying it is part of a larger boundary or fence. The background is a broad, open field that appears to be plowed or barren, with no visible vegetation, under a clear sky. The horizon is flat with a few sparse, distant trees, and possibly small structures visible. The setting suggests a rural or agricultural area with strict access restrictions. The emphasis is on private property rights and prohibitions against trespassing and fishing.
title: This sign on the Colorado River is misspelled but the message is clear.
